column1:
Air Cars (World)>Air Cars>1997>ESRB - E (Everyone)>ICD>MidNite Entertainment Group Inc.>Driving>1.9>1-8 Players>AirCars takes place in the future after a nuclear holocaust.
The large organization E.B.N.E.R.S. is plotting to take over the world and has developed advanced forcefield and teleportation systems
column2: and nuclear powered AirCars. To stop the plot
column3: your group steals plans
column4: builds its own AirCar
column5: and sets out to destroy all of the bases
column6: 28 known and countless unknown ones
column7:
stationed around the globe.
You can choose to play a single player game
column8: the 2-player game using a JagLink
column9: or up to 8 players using ICD's CatBoxes. On screen and on radar
column10: each player's AirCar is displayed in a different color to help identify the good guys from the bad guys. There are 3 difficulty settings. You will be using the cockpit's instrument panel to fly the AirCar
column11: select weapons and view radar
column12:
as well as combating the enemy in the air and shooting ground targets.
Features include true 3D sound
column13: a computer voice (which can be turned off if desired)
column14: and music during the introduction and level intermissions.

column1:
Alien vs Predator (World)>Alien vs Predator>1994>ESRB - K-A (Kids to Adults)>Atari Games>Rebellion Developments Ltd.>Shooter>4.0>1 Player>The Jaguar version of Alien vs. Predator is completely different from the Arcade and SNES games of the same name.
The Jaguar version takes place entirely on a Colonial Marine Training base. A ship infested with Aliens is found floating near the outer-space training facility. Of course
column2: once the Aliens get inside the base
column3: they kill off nearly everyone. Meanwhile
column4: the Predators dock their ship on the training base as well. They see this as an opportunity to catch an Alien Queen
column5:
and bring honor to their clan.
So there are three scenarios in which to play: First
column6: you can play as a Marine. Your job is to find a way to self-destruct the base
column7: and make your way to an escape pod before it blows. The second scenario allows you to play as an Alien. Here
column8: your job is to find and protect the Queen from the Marines and the Predators. Finally
column9:
you can play as the Predator. The Predator must simply find and kill the Alien Queen.
The game plays like a first person shooter. The play field consists of the 5 levels of the training base
column10: plus areas for the Predator and Alien ships. All the areas of the ship are inter-connected
column11: giving the game a huge virtual environment. Depending on the scenario you choose
column12: you will have to choose different strategies based on the capabilities of your character. For example
column13: the Marine will have to make use of his weapons and his ability to use the ship's computer terminals. The Aliens
column15: will have to make use of their great numbers and ability to cocoon their enemies. And finally the Predator must fight with honor
column16: and not over-use his invisibility capability.

column1: Atari Karts (World)>Atari Karts>1995>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari Games>Miracle Designs>Driving>3.2>1-2 Players>Atari Karts is a character-based go-kart racing game. It plays very similarly to Super Mario Kart. The emphasis in this game
column2: like most kart games
column3:
is on making use of pick-up items found around the track to knock out your opponents.
There is only one game mode
column4: a points based cup series. There are four difficulty levels
column5: each with 3 cups to race for. After completing all the cups for a difficulty level
column6: you get to challenge a "boss" kart in a single race match. If you beat the boss
column7: he becomes a playable character. The various cup races can be played in either single player or two player split screen modes.

column1: Attack of the Mutant Penguins (World)>Attack of the Mutant Penguins>1996>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari Games>Sunrise Games Ltd.>Action>3.6>1 Player>Your job is to guide Rodney or Bernard through a series of levels in order to stop the attacking mutants. The mutant penguins win the level if they are able to get more soldiers to the scale and tip it in their favor. You win if you are able to lead the good penguins to the scale.
Battle Sphere Gold (World)>Battle Sphere Gold>2000>ESRB - E (Everyone)>ScatoLogic>ScatoLogic>Flying>2.8>1-8 Players>A 3D space combat simulator
column2:
BattleSphere's story was based upon an episode in the original Star Trek television series and it plays similarly to Star Raiders.
Seven alien races vie against each other - the victor will control the galaxy. They meet in an arena in Sector 51
column3: a spherical sector of space formerly used by the Earth government to secretly test new weapons and starships. Gameplay consists of 5 different play modes with different scenarios and goals. Choose from various starships (each with unique weapons systems) and battle the aliens
column4: who have also chosen their best fighters and have many space ships of their own.

column1: Brutal Sports Football (World)>Brutal Sports Football>1994>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari Games>Teque London Ltd.>Football/Sports>3.2>1-2 Players>Similar to Speedball 2 in many ways
column2: this is an ultra-violent sports game. Matches last 7 minutes
column3: and the aim is to get the ball into a goal at each end
column4: guarded by a net-minder. The ball can be thrown or kicked
column5: and is an oval
column6:
resulting in frequent up-and-under type kicks.
The gameplay is fast and flowing
column7: and has one rule - if you can't get the ball
column8: get the man
column9: and decapitate him if possible. Bonus and non-bonus items appear on the pitch
column10: such as bombs to throw at opponents
column11: rabbits to speed up the current player
column12:
or tortoises to slow him down.
Teams consist of humans and aliens
column13: many of which have their own unique skills. There's a lot of blood and flailing limbs
column14: giving things a gruesomely humorous edge. There are four leagues to progress through
column15: plus a knockout cup and single matches.

column1:
Bubsy in Fractured Furry Tales (World)>Bubsy in Fractured Furry Tales>1994>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Accolade>Imagitec Design Inc.>Platform>3.8>1-2 Players>Bubsy in Fractured Furry Tales is the only Bubsy game to appear on the Atari Jaguar. It's a side scrolling platform game similar to the Genesis and SNES Bubsy series.
Bubsy is a bobcat superhero who can defeat all enemies by jumping on top of them. In Fractured Furry Tales
column2: he finds himself in a series of childrens stories. These aren't the Disney-style happy fairy tales
column3: though. These are the dark
column4: disturbing Grimm-style fairy tales. So
column5: Bubsy has to travel through 15 levels and set things right.

column1: Cannon Fodder (World)>Cannon Fodder>1995>ESRB - T (Teen)>Virgin Interactive>Sensible Software>Strategy>4.1>1 Player>Guide a team of up to four soldiers through 72 levels of combat in this innovative top-down action/strategy hybrid
column2: best thought of as Lemmings crossed with Commando crossed with Dune 2. The characters are controlled indirectly using the mouse
column3: as you activate each soldier or group of them by highlighting them
column4: click the left button to move them to a particular spot
column5: and the right button for them to fire guns at an enemy. You can also pick up grenades
column6:
which can be used to destroy groups of enemies or buildings (by pressing both buttons at once).
Each mission has a specific objective
column7: and some feature vehicles such as tanks to make things easier. Your troops can cross water but can't shoot within it
column8: so finding and controlling bridges is often crucial. You can use the arrangement of trees to find hiding places to shoot from
column9: and should watch out for CPU soldiers also doing so.

column1: Checkered Flag (World)>Checkered Flag>1994>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari Games>Rebellion Developments Ltd.>Driving>2.4>1 Player>Checkered Flag for the Jaguar is a 3D F1-style racing game. The racing game staples are here: single race
column2: practice
column3: and tournament. You can choose to set up a variety of options for each race
column4: also. You can choose various weather conditions. Or
column5: you can set up your car to change it's handling characteristics. There are 10 different tracks on which to race
column6: each with a different theme. Some take place on sunny beaches
column7: others take place in the arctic.

column1: Club Drive (World)>Club Drive>1994>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari>Atari Corporation>Driving>1.9>1-2 Players>It is the future
column2:
and the most popular theme park around is Club Drive. Scientists have managed to invent indestructible cars. Patrons to Club Drive can drive these cars around imaginative environments and play outrageous driving games.
Club Drive as a Jaguar game is a simple driving simulator. You are put in the drivers seat
column3: and can race through some large environments. The racing areas available are: an old west ghost town
column4: San Francisco
column5: a giant house
column6: and a simple hot-wheels style track. In addition to the racing modes
column7: there are object collection and 2-player tag modes. These modes are played out in smaller versions of the areas described above.

column1: Cybermorph (World) (Rev 2)>Cybermorph>1993>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari>Attention to Detail Limited>Shooter>3.4>1 Player>Cybermorph was the first game released for Atari's Jaguar console. It's a 3d sci-fi shoot-'em-up. The story goes like this: The evil Pernitia Empire is swallowing up the galaxy's planets left and right. What's worse
column2:
the resistance forces have had their secret weapons stolen from them and put into pods spread out on many different planets. You must pilot the T-Griffon morphing attack craft to each planet and recover the pods to stop the Pernitians.
So
column3: in each planet
column4: or level
column5: you must collect a certain number of pods and make it to the exit before the enemies shoot you down. Fortunately
column6: there are power-ups that can strategically enhance the T-Griffon's offensive capabilities. After clearing 8 planets
column7: you take on a boss creature/ship before moving on to the next sector. There are 4 levels like this to clear
column8: each with progressively increasing difficulty.

column1: Defender 2000 (World)>Defender 2000>1996>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari Games>Atari Corporation>Shooter>4.4>1-2 Players>Defender 2000 is an update of the classic arcade game by Eugene Jarvis. This Jaguar game features a port of the original game
column2:
and two updated versions: Defender Plus and Defender 2000.
Defender combines a side scrolling shooter with a search and rescue game. You control a ship that travels left and right above the planets surface. Alien lander craft warp into the play area
column3: and begin to descend to the surface. Along the surface
column4: there are humanoids ripe for the picking. The alien landers grab the humanoids and begin to carry them up the screen. You have to shoot the landers before they reach the top of the screen
column5:
and catch the humanoids before they fall to the surface.
The Defender Plus update features gameplay that is very similar to the original
column6: and graphics that have a crazy
column7: psychedelic look. The Defender 2000 update adds playfields that scroll in both directions
column8: weapon power-ups
column9: bonus rounds
column10: improved graphics
column11: and extremely high speed gameplay.

column1: Doom (World)>Doom>1994>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari Games>id Software
column2: Inc.>Shooter>4.4>1-2 Players>The Union Aerospace Corporation has been experimenting with teleportation technology on Mars' moons Phobos and Deimos. After early successes
column3: something goes wrong. It seems the scientists have opened a gateway straight to Hell. Phobos base is overrun with demonic creatures
column4: and the whole of Deimos simply vanishes. A squad of marines is sent to Phobos
column5:
but all except one are quickly slaughtered. It falls to the surviving marine to grab some guns and strike back at the demons.
id Software's follow-up to their genre-defining Wolfenstein 3D
column6: DOOM is another first person shooter: full-on action seen from the space marine's perspective. Like Wolfenstein
column7: the game consists of distinct episodes
column8: playable in any order. The first episode
column9: Knee-Deep in the Dead
column10: takes place in the Phobos base and is freely available as shareware. The full game continues on Deimos in The Shores of Hell and culminates in Inferno
column11: the final episode which takes place in Hell itself. Each episode consists of nine levels
column12:
one of which is a hidden level.
The basic objective in each level is simply to reach the exit. Since dozens of enemies stand in the way
column13:
the only way to get there is through killing them. Switches and buttons must be
pressed to advance at certain points and often color-coded locked doors will block the way - matching keycards or skull keys must be found to pass.
DOOM's engine technology is more advanced than Wolfenstein's
column14: and thus the levels are more varied and complex. The engine simulates different heights (stairs and lifts appear frequently) and different lighting conditions (some rooms are pitch black
column15: others only barely illuminated). There are outdoor areas
column16: pools of radioactive waste that hurt the player
column17: ceilings that come down and crush him
column18: and unlike Wolfenstein's orthogonally aligned corridors
column19:
the walls in DOOM can be in any angle to each other. An automap helps in navigating the levels.
Stylistically
column20: the levels begin with a futuristic theme in the military base on Phobos and gradually change to a hellish environment
column22: upside-down-crosses and portraits of horned demons)
column23:
hung-up mutilated corpses and the distorted faces of the damned.
DOOM features a large weapon arsenal
column24: with most weapons having both advantages and drawbacks. The starting weapons are the fists and a simple pistol. Also available are a shotgun (high damage
column28: but slightly inaccurate in longer bursts) and a plasma rifle (combining a high firing rate and large damage). The rocket launcher also deals out lots of damage
column29: but the explosion causes blast damage and must be used with care in confined areas or it might prove deadly to the player as well as the enemies. Two further (in)famous weapons in DOOM are the chainsaw for close-quarter carnage
column32: while taking some practice to fire correctly
column33: can destroy most enemies in a single burst. The different weapons use four different ammunition types (bullets
column36:
so collecting the right type for a certain gun is important.
DOOM drops some of Wolfenstein's arcade-inspired aspects
column37: so there are no extra lives or treasures to be collected for points
column38: but many other powerups are still available. Medpacks heal damage while armor protects from receiving it in the first place. Backpacks allow more ammunition to be carried
column39: a computer map reveals the whole layout of the level on the automap (including any secret areas)
column40:
light amplification visors illuminate dark areas and radiation suits allow travel over waste without taking damage. Also available are berserk packs (which radically increase the damage inflicted by the fists) as well as short-time invisibility and invulnerability powerups.
The enemies to be destroyed include former humans corrupted during the invasion
column41: plus demons in all shapes and sizes: fireball-throwing imps
column43:
pink-skinned demons with powerful bite attacks and large one-eyed flying monstrosities called Cacodemons. Each episode ends with a boss battle against one or two especially powerful creatures.
DOOM popularized multiplayer in the genre with two different modes: Cooperative allows up to four players to move through the single-player game together
column44:
while Deathmatch is a competitive game type where players blast at each other to collect 'frag' points for a kill and re-spawn in
a random location after being killed.

column1: Double Dragon V - The Shadow Falls (World)>Double Dragon V - The Shadow Falls>1995>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Tradewest>Leland Interactive Media>Beat-'Em-Up>1.9>1-2 Players>Double Dragon returns
column2: this time as a VS. fighter
column3: in the same mold as Street Fighter. Based on the Double Dragon animated series
column4: which is loosely based on the original arcade game
column5:
Jimmy and Billy and a host of other characters fight it out in a tournament fighter.
The Shadow Master
column6: who has created a deadly virus which he plans to destroy the world with
column7: is waiting for you at the end of the path to victory. You'll have to fight your way through many evil characters before you face the Shadow Master. Beat him
column8: and the world is saved for another day.

column1: Dragon - The Bruce Lee Story (World)>Dragon - The Bruce Lee Story>1994>ESRB - T (Teen)>Atari Games>Virgin Interactive Entertainment (Europe) Ltd.>Platform>3.2>1-2 Players>Dragon: The Bruce Lee Story is a action/fighting game in which you play Bruce Lee
column2:
the infamous martial arts master.
As you go through the different levels
column3: the game follows the format of the 1993 Universal movie of the same name
column4:
but is not identical to it.
As Bruce Lee
column5: you can perform a wide variety of high-flying martial arts moves
column6: roundhouse kicks
column7: flying kicks
column8: flying chops and throws. Defeat a multitude of new opponents and build up your Chi in order to gain special abilities and weapons.

column1: Evolution - Dino Dudes (World)>Evolution - Dino Dudes>1994>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari>Imagitec Design Inc.>Puzzle>3.3>1 Player>Your job in this action puzzler is to help prehistoric man to evolve by helping them discover tools
column2: the wheel
column3: weapons
column4: or even fire. Each level in the game will have a given task to help in this
column5: and you are allotted a number of characters who must accomplish the task. The player can switch from person to person while moving the characters around each scrolling puzzle
column6:
and teamwork is essential to success.
Tasks can include finding objects (like a spear) on the screen
column7: or trying to reach a specific destination which may require the use of objects you have discovered so far. Each level has a time limit
column8: when time runs out the level can be restarted.

column1: Fever Pitch Soccer (World) (En
column2: Fr
column3: De
column4: Es
column5: It)>Fever Pitch Soccer>1995>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari Games>U.S. Gold Ltd.>Soccer/Sports>3.5>1-2 Players>In this isometric football game
column6: 50 national teams are represented to play in two game modes: Exhibition and Tournament (a series of seven games on four continents
column7: with a final against the World All-Stars)
column8: with the ability to set time
column9: difficulty level
column10:
see cutscenes after goals and if players are free to kick each other around without (many) fouls.
While the game seems short-featured for 1995 standards
column11: the tournament mode includes a twist: depending on how well the player defeats his opponents
column13: who won't do anything spectacular (but at least fill up the ranks) for star players
column15:
are able to cross and backheel the ball but also have a unique ability at the disposal of the player:
1. The Marker: can latch on an opposing player
column16:
stopping him from running away with the ball;
2. Goalkeeper 1: more capable of stopping shots than the regular goalkeeper;
3. Barger: this large
column17:
muscular player is able to shove everyone in his path;
4. Tricky: capable of jumping (or bunny-hopping
column18: to be more precise) with the ball tucked between his feet
column19:
avoiding tackles;
5. The Cheat: while it's hard to talk about fair play in a game where kicking a defenders' leg to gain a corner is (mostly) a legitimate play
column20: this player takes the whole thing into the next level
column21: being able to dig fouls out of nowhere
column22: at the expense of the ball (if he's carrying it or the referee waves play on) or just some stains in his shirt (if he's trying to pull an offensive foul)
column23:
with the odds of 50/50 (25% for penalties);
6. Passer: capable of feeding forwards with laser-precision passes;
7. Striker 1: capable of unleashing impossibly-sliced shots
column24:
scoring from virtually any position in the offensive area;
8. Striker 2: best used from positions directly in front of goal
column25:
this striker features a shot that is so powerful the ball ignites as it approaches the goal;
9. Goalkeeper 2: features a better chance of stopping special shots from both Strikers;
In Exhibition games teams start with their own setup of start players
column26: from none to a full team. The playing surface also affects gameplay - playing in wet grass removes all ball bounce
column29: a rocky field where the ball can change direction after hitting the ground
column31: poor attempts on goals and vice-versa.

column1: Fight for Life (World)>Fight for Life>1996>ESRB - T (Teen)>Atari Games>Atari Corporation>Fighter>3.4>1-2 Players>Fight for Life is a 3D fighting game that takes place in hell. The player controls one of eight deceased fighters competing to earn a chance to escape and return to the world of the living. After they defeat an opponent they not only move on to the next round
column2:
but also learn two of the opponent's moves.
This is the only 3D fighting game released for the Jaguar. It features brightly-colored texture mapped fighters and arenas. Gameplay is very similar to Virtua Fighter
column3: in that the moves more-or-less look like real martial arts.

column1: Flashback - The Quest for Identity (World) (En
column2: Fr)>Flashback - The Quest for Identity>1995>ESRB - E (Everyone)>U.S. Gold>Delphine Software International>Platform>3.2>1 Player>The year is 2142. You play as Conrad B. Hart
column3: a man who has lost his memory. After barely escaping from hostile aliens
column4: Conrad's bike crashes on an unknown planet. Conrad finds himself in the jungle
column5:
and from now on his quest for survival and his lost identity begins.
"Flashback" is a platform action adventure. You navigate Conrad over the platforms
column6: performing various moves. You can simply jump or do a longer run-and-jump
column7: run
column8: climb
column9: hang off ledges
column10: and pick up objects lying on the ground. To defend yourself
column11: you shoot enemies with your gun and also use various objects (such as stones) to harm or to distract them.

column1: Flip Out! (World)>Flip Out!>1995>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari Games>Gorilla Systems Corporation>Puzzle>3.1>1 Player>FlipOut! is a puzzle game starring aliens from the planet Phrohmaj. Your objective in each puzzle is simple: you must place all the colored tiles into the correct spaces on the board. The tricky part is that there is always one more tile than there are spaces. That means you are always juggling at least one tile in the air. The game becomes more difficult as you have to juggle more tiles
column2:
and the Phrohmajians try to interfere.
This game features nine bizarre areas
column3: each with multiple puzzles. The graphics feature a lot of crazy animation of the Phrohmaj onlookers and lots of bright and colorful tiles.

column1: Hover Strike (World)>Hover Strike>1995>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari Games>Atari Corporation>Flying>3.0>1-2 Players>Terrakian Pirates have taken over a colonized planet under Federation control. They've set up an atmospheric cannon
column2: making invasion impossible. Your job
column3: as a hovercraft pilot
column4:
is to launch a pre-emptive strike on the planet's surface.
Hover Strike for the Jaguar is a mission-based tank game. In each mission
column5: you will drop to the surface of the planet
column6: destroy some targets
column7: and then return to your ship in orbit. The hovercraft you pilot is heavily armored and includes various weapons systems to take out enemies and targets.

column1: Hyper Force (World)>Hyper Force>2000>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Songbird Productions>Visual Impact>Platform>3.0>1 Player>HyperForce is an action sci-fi platform game with 2D graphics. You play a warrior who has been sent to destroy Trans Con
column2:
a deadly outfit that plans to attack Terran.
There is plenty of fighting to do - shooting soldiers
column3: security drones and robots. You'll also be avoiding traps
column4: finding switches to open doors and shooting down breakable walls to find hidden areas with goodies and bonus points. In between levels
column5:
spend the money you've found to upgrade your weapon by visiting a shopkeeper.
Exploration is a major part of the game
column6: so the levels can be larger than they first appear.

column1: I-War (World)>I-War>1995>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari Games>Imagitec Design Inc.>Driving>3.2>1-2 Players>The giant supercomputer that controls the world's information has been infected with viruses. You must enter the virtual world known as the I-Way
column2:
and clear them out with your anti-virus tank.
I-War is a 3D virtual reality tank game. In each of the 21 levels
column3: you must find all the data pods and make your way to the exit. Enemy tanks
column4: turrets
column5: and bombers stand in your way
column6: as well as occasional traps or locked doors controlled by hidden switches. Levels are divided into simple
column7: enclosed rooms
column8:
linearly connected by one-way teleporters.
You can select a fast
column9: medium
column10: or heavy tank at the beginning of the game
column11: with its abilities reflected in the strength of its guns or the amount of punishment it can absorb. Throughout the game
column12: you will also find weapon power-ups and tank upgrades (such as shields
column14:
and auto-targeting) to help you stay effective against the increasing numbers of enemy defenders. You can save your progress to the cart at the end of each level.
Between levels are bonus rounds where you pilot your tank through a corridor and try to collect a set percentage of data pods. Meeting that percentage earns you an extra life.

column1: Iron Soldier (World) (v1.04)>Iron Soldier>1994>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari Games>Eclipse Software Design>Simulation>4.0>1 Player>It is the future
column2: and the earth has been covered with wastelands and cities. The powerful
column3: faceless Iron First Corporation has replaced the last forms of free government. Now
column4: they are developing a new
column5: 42-foot
column6: armed robot known as the Iron Soldier. With the Iron Soldier
column7: no one will be able to stop the Iron First Corporation. The only hope is the Resistance
column8:
a group that has managed to capture one of the Iron Soldier prototypes. You are a pilot for the Resistance. It's up to you to pilot the robot and bring down the Iron Fist.
Iron Soldier is mech sim played from an in-cockpit view. There are 16 single player missions. Objectives involve taking out certain targets
column9: defending convoys
column10: collecting items
column11: and so on.

column1: Kasumi Ninja (World)>Kasumi Ninja>1994>ESRB - M (Mature)>Atari Games>Hand Made Software
column2: Ltd.>Fighter>2.6>1-2 Players>On the tiny island of Kasumi
column3: there exists a portal between this world and the Netherworld. For many centuries
column4: this portal has been kept closed by the balance between good and evil forces. Now
column5: the dark ninja lord Gyaku has defeated the forces of good
column6: and opened the portal to the netherworld. It is up to you
column7: a Kasumi ninja
column8:
to stop Gyaku and restore balance to the world.
Kasumi Ninja is a one-on-one fighting game featuring digitized character graphics. There are 8 fighters for you to choose from
column9: each with their own fighting environments.

column1:
Missile Command 3D (World)>Missile Command 3D>1995>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Atari Games>Virtuality Entertainment Ltd.>Action>3.6>1 Player>Missile Command 3D is an update to the classic Atari arcade game. The goal in Missile Command is to defend your cities against an onslaught of missiles coming from the sky. Your arsenal consists of three anti-missile flak cannons. You have to position the anti-missile clouds in the path of the incoming missiles to stop them from impacting.
This Jaguar game has 3 modes. First
column2: there is a port of the original arcade game. There are neat extras for this mode like graphic backdrops and the ability to resize or scale the screen. The second mode is Missile Command 3D. This mode retains the gameplay of the original
column3: but adds 3D graphics to the mix. The final mode
column4: Virtual Missile Command
column5: changes things up quite a lot. Instead of anti-missile flak
column6: your cannons shoot lasers. This means you don't need to lead your targets anymore. You play the game from a first-person perspective
column7: and must switch between the three cannons via buttons on the keypad. There are nine levels in this mode
column8: each with a boss at the end.

column1: NBA Jam T.E. (World)>NBA Jam T.E.>1996>ESRB - E (Everyone)>Acclaim>Midway Games
column2: Inc.>Basketball/Sports>4.3>1-4 Players>This game lets you play two-on-two arcade basketball with players from all the NBA teams. Gameplay is fast and action-packed
column3: with few rules
column4: no fouls
column5: and deliberately unrealistic jamming. Players are rated on eight ability categories
column6: from steals and blocks
column7:
to dunks and 3-pointers.
Up to four human players can take part
column8: each always controlling a single player for their team
column9: and AI for missing players. This allows for four players to face each other in teams of two
column10:
or for two players to team up against a third player with a CPU team-mate.
The Tournament Edition ups each team's roster to three players
column11: and allows for substitutions between quarters. Shoving players now results in injuries
column12: which lower a player's stats; encouraging you to sub them out and let them recover. Aside from the usual secret characters and cheat modes
column13:
the T.E. also includes four new additions you can individually enable from the special options menu:
1. "Hot Spots" are randomized zones on the court that reward extra points (up to a 9-point shot!) for making a basket while standing within them.
Powerup icons appear randomly
column14: and convey temporary arcade-like benefits when picked up. Some examples are instant "on-fire
column16: monster dunks from anywhere on the court
column17:
or a bomb that knocks all other players to the ground.
"Juice Mode" increases the speed of the game up to 4x.
